Hi,

Simple question - when using the JUnit 'fail()' method to fail a test
when I expect an exception to be thrown (as per the JUnit
documentation), surely *ALL* code coverage tools will report that the
'fail()' statement is never executed (since my test correctly throws
the expected exception):

  try {
    doWork();
    fail("Exception should be thrown - GET CODE COVERAGE WARNING!");
  }
  catch (Exception e) {
    // Success!!
  }

Should I try and rework this code, or can I configure Clover (the tool
I'm currently using that causes me this problem) to tell it to ignore
JUnit 'fail()' calls?

Thanks,

Pat.
